review_text: I had a great time white water rafting at Zoar Outdoor! It was well-organized and the guides were experienced and friendly. We had Brian as a guide and he was great! We did the Zoar gap trip this time, I would love to go back and do the dry run rapids next time. We also stayed at the Hawk Mountain lodge which was very convenient. We booked the Deerfield suite which was spacious and clean. The A/C was a portable unit and wasn't working very well. Other than that, there were no complaints. The staff was professional and helpful and we had a wonderful time!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Olivia, thanks so much for taking the time to share your experience! We're so glad that you had an amazing rafting with us, and we'd love to have you join us on the Dryway! We also wanted you to know that the A/C unit is on our radar, and we appreciate your feedback. Hope you have a great day!

review_text: We went zip lining today for the first time and had the time of our lives. The course is so awesome and the zips are a blast. The guides are incredible. We had Kyle and Viv and they absolutely ramped the experience up to the next level. Such a cool place and such a cool experience. Zoar absolutely rocks!!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tyler! We're thrilled to hear that you had a blast zipping with Kyle and Viv! Thanks for taking the time to share your experience, we hope to see you back soon for more adventures!

review_text: We had such an amazing white water rafting trip on the Deerfield River with Zoar! Our group had wanted to do it for years and finally made it happen. Our guide Isaac was very knowledgeable and friendly and ensured we had a safe and enjoyable experience. It made for a great kick off to our girls weekend. Highly recommend Zoar Outdoor, and a big thank you to Isaac!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Angela! We're so glad you had a great time kicking off your girls weekend on the river with us! Thanks for sharing your experience, we hope to see you all back for more adventures!

review_text:
On Sunday June 9, 2024 our entire family, a group of 14 ranging in ages from 10-75 gathered at Zoar Outdoor to celebrate my husband's 75th birthday.
Our guides, Bailey, Jen, Kate and Wayne were professional, knowledgeable, patient but best of all so much fun!
The afternoon was filled with exhilarating zip lining, breath-taking scenery and lots of laughs.
A truly memorable experience was had by all.
Thank You.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Chris! We're thrilled that your family had such a great time celebrating your husband's birthday! Thank you so much for your kind words, we're so happy that our guides were able to create a memorable experience for you all. We hope to see you again for more adventures!

review_text: We did the half-day rafting adventure.  My wife was very anxious about participating, but within minutes of starting the trip she was thoroughly enjoying the experience thanks to our AMAZING guide, Tera!  She was knowledgeable and confident and had lots of great information to share along the trip.  There were 6 of us, Grandparents, Parents, and Teens, so we had our own raft.  It was the highlight of our week in the Berkshires.  Everyone involved with Zoar was patient, knowledgeable and upbeat!  They have an terrific staff.  I highly recommend this experience when you are visiting the Berkshires!

A Great time! Myself and my two teens had great time on the zip line adventure! Our Guides, were very informative and relaxed at the same time. It was welcoming atmosphere where we felt safe. The zips start easy and never get hard but end up longer and faster.  Great for beginners and  experienced zippers alike!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Mike! We are so happy to hear you had such an amazing time ziplining with your family! Thanks for taking the time to share your experience. We hope to have  you back to do some more adventuring with us!

review_text: Even though it ended up being an overcast and slightly rainy day, we had a great time! Our guide Tera was the best!! Since this was our first time rafting, we took the class II with one class III rapid adventure, but next time it'll be the III-IV. Very thankful that we managed to stay ahead of the dam release which if we had started much later could have been a disappointment, but the timing worked out perfect. Another note, this adventure package said that it came with lunch, and we expected very basic sandwiches and maybe a bag of chips, but they definitely over-delivered with great selections and taste! And tasty homemade cookies! Thank you!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tracy! We're so happy to hear you had such an amazing time rafting with Tera. Thanks for taking the time to share your experience on the Gap, we can't wait to see you again for the Dryway!

review_text: My daughter and I visited Zoar Outdoor today for ziplining.  It was my daughters first time and my second time visiting.  We had the best time ever!!!!  Thank you to Kyle,  Bailey and Aidan for making our trip so much fun.  Lots of good laughs   I highly recommend Zoar Outdoor.  They are packed full of adventures.
response_from_owner_text: Hi, thank you for your wonderful review! We appreciate you coming back to visit us and bringing your daughter along for the adventure! So happy to hear that you had a blast with Kyle, Bailey, and Aidan. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

review_text: We had a great experience earlier this week. The staff are friendly and helpful. The river is so clean and not too cold. I do recommend going on a sunny, warm day. Being in the water for 4 hours can get chilly, so the sun feels nice. It's a fun adventure for a family or a group of friends.

Beautiful trip down a picturesque, quiet river with various (small) rapids, depths, and speeds. We appreciated how there were two pickup options, one for around 2 hours and the other for around 4. We did the longer trip and loved it. Great business too with timely and clean transportation.

We had the best day as a family tubing on the Deerfield River. Danielle and Christopher were absolutely wonderful and looked after us so well. They went above and beyond for us. We couldn't recommend them highly enough. Thank you so much!
Fantastic customer service. We had reservations and the weather wasn't ideal, so they reached out and gave us the option to reschedule, receive a credit or refund. Very thoughtful
07/16/2022 was my My second tubing experience here and by far was the best!!!  Friendly atmosphere, great scenery , being at peace with Mother Nature.

Had the most enjoyable tubing experience today!!!!!  The owner was so kind and helpful and the tubing was so relaxing and so much fun.  There were some thrilling rapids and some relaxing spots, a perfect mix of both!  We thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience and highly rate this outfit!!!!!  We loved it!!!!!     Thank you!!!!!!!!!
highly recommend! staff was kind and well organized making for a seamless experience. the river was gorgeous and relaxing.

Fun little adventure tubing down this gentle river. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. Someone went way above expectations long after our trip, and returned a lost valuable to us from the river.
As I watched the sun set, and it's warmth and reflection hit the flowing waters, there was some kind of connection with nature, so peaceful and calming.

Wonderful visit and stay at the Mohawk forest and campground. Very helpful rangers. Clean bathrooms and showers. Very large bear boxes on the campsites. Campsites are very well kept and have fire rings. Will gladly stay here again.
One of my favorite places. Great fishing and good to kayak or tube on. I have been going here a long time I have great memories with my kids for a lifetime.
Love the Deerfield.
Beautiful views throughout the Mohawk trail!!!
Gorgeous place.
Great for rafting, zip line Fishing, Camping it's all right in our backyard

Excellent place to enjoy nature.
But too many rafts

All around experience from beginning to end friendly, professional, interesting and fun. Water was fast and scary but that"s why I went and was not disappointed. Great dinner afterwards. Was fun to talk with other rafters and guides. Great time. I highly recommend you try it.
An absolutely blast, the guides work very hard so everyone has a fun a safe experience.

It's my 1st time go rafting and really had lots of fun thanks to our captain Lilly who is super skilled and knowledgeable and has a very pleasant personality. We played a bunch of water games so there's also fun during the 2-hour journey.
response_from_owner_text: We are so glad you enjoyed rafting with us! I will pass along your kind words to Lilly too!

review_text: The raft guides were so friendly! Super experienced with river, gave great information about the Rapids. Talked with everyone while in raft....amazing personalities!! Made the trip for me and my 14 year old teen exciting fun and special.  Perfect to get a real unique outdoor experience with great people and making new friends!

A group of friends and I celebrated a friend's birthday today by white water rafting at Berkshire Whitewater- we had the best time! Our guide Max was awesome... he was knowledgeable and made our experience rafting so incredibly fun. Most of our group was rafting for the first time and we had an experience hard to beat! After rafting, swimming and enjoying the gorgeous fall foliage we had a really nice lunch at the restaurant at Berkshire. I would highly recommend going there if you're looking for an awesome day of fun and adventure for a great price!

My wife and I have been rafting 5-6 times in Maine and West Virginia - usually up to class four and five rapids. Now we have three boys and wanted to introduce them to the activity. They are ages 10, 12 and 14. This was our first trip on the Deerfield river and it was a perfect family adventure. The crew was fantastic- all very well trained and great at communicating everything so we felt ready and safe. They knew how to make thing fun and were very friendly. We did the Fife trip and it was a great intro to for the kids. They served lunch which I wish was fancier but it did the job.

Super fun! I was scared on the bus ride to the water. I would totally recommend!

The instructor was yelling about safety and wearing 'brain-buckets' (helmets) and the 'boat-splosion' (capsized boat). He was pretty great. Man, if only I could remember his name that he yelled so often. (He is the bearded man in the picture.)

Wicked fun time! I would definitely be interested in going again in the future!
Floating on the river... Most amazing trip ever with my squad. And the most wonderful guide..

I recently went on a rafting adventure with Crab apple, and it was an absolutely incredible experience from start to finish! The staff were professional and knowledgeable. Our guide, Sawyer was not only skilled and experienced but also enthusiastic and friendly, ensuring that everyone in the raft felt comfortable and excited.

I highly recommend Crab Apple to anyone looking for an unforgettable rafting experience. Whether you're a seasoned rafter or a first-timer, you're guaranteed to have a fantastic time. I can't wait to come back and do it all over again!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you, thank you! Great review. You were lucky to have Sawyer as the guide as his enthusiasm is infectious. We all love the river and what we do every day!

review_text: BSA Troop 4 Hopkinton, MA had an awesome time on the river. The River guides were super knowledgeable on their craft and the rapids, guided us for safety and teamwork to have the most fun!! Food back at the base was just as amazing on the banks of the river. The support team and admins were super helpful and engaging. We had fantastic time and no doubt be back with some new scouts and I'm sure with some repeats!!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Troop 4! What a great day with kids on the easier trip and kids on the harder rapids. The kids were full of energy and great all day. Can;t wait for the next trip with Troop 4.

review_text: AN AMAZING DAY! Overall, a great experience for people looking for a challenging activity on a hot summer day. Thank you Zach for being a great guide and great company on the boat!! To start the day, you are greeted with very welcoming guides/workers when you pull into the lot that will confirm your party, provide info, and direct you to a parking spot. The check in process is VERY easy and everyone is very kind. During check in, you will pick out your lunch/dinner option (with many to choose from), rent water shoes if you do not have ones that will stay on, and give your car keys to the front desk for safe keeping. Once at the water, this company does not make you load in your boat which was a major benefit! They were already in the water when we arrived. Being on the water is the star of the show!! Expect to be on the water for a few hours and bring a water bottle with a clasp to hook in the boat if you think you need that. Once you get back to camp, plan on changing into a dry set of clothes and having the perfect dinner after a day on the water. Thank you to all the amazing staff for such a great experience!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for this detailed review and helpful recommendations for future rafters. Always a fun ride with Zach, third generation Crab Apple family member.

review_text: I can't say enough about Crabapple Whitewater - the rooms are clean and cozy, the grounds are gorgeous and relaxing, the food is fantastic ... but the best part is the staff, seriously the nicest people you'll ever meet it's like hanging out with people you've known forever. The actual raft trip was an absolute blast, we were lucky to go on a dam release day and had bald eagles flying overhead.  Courtney was our guide and homegirl knew her stuff. We were joined by 2 members of the staff (Connor and Lilly) to fill our boat and they were just such fun people who had us laughing the whole time while sharing cool info about the river. You can tell they love what they do. I can't wait to go back with my family, best and most laid back easy peasy vacation ever.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for rafting with us at our location in Maine. Sounds like a relaxin adventure with our Family and awesome raft guides. We look forward to rafting with your family later this summer.

review_text: First time going to this location and it exceeded my expectations. Matt was an outstanding guide. We learned a lot about rafting, nature, and shared some laughs. We had a total of seven in our group and he treated everyone amazing. I'm sure all the guides are great, but when we come back next time. We will be sure to request Matt.
response_from_owner_text: Nice! We will let Matt know that you had a great time on the river with him and will be requesting him when you return for the next trip.

review_text: Our family had so much fun whitewater rafting! My sister and I did the Monroe Bridge ride with our kids ages 15-20 yrs old - all first time rafters but athletic kids that could handle all the paddling and strategy involved. Frank was our guide and we felt so safe with him as he gave us tons of instructions but at the same time, let us all feel like we were a big part of the journey. We all loved it and I highly recommend this as a family outing since they combine the great meal after rafting and then the slideshow to see all the amazing photos taken of all the rafts in our group. It was a great, "unplugged" day for us all in the beautiful setting.  I loved learning all about the Crab Apple family business - you can definitely tell they care about every detail of the experience. Highly recommend!
response_from_owner_text: What a fun day for all of the cousins! So hard sometimes to find a family activity that the teens all love. We found one = rafting some Class 3 and 4 rapids!! We love hosting kids like yours that can paddle and are psyched to try something new.

review_text: Perfect 10/10 experience! Went rafting with my kids and my sisters kids. We did the 15 plus option. Frank our guide and the owner was awesome. So professional, but also very fun! Personalized the experience and made it a great day for all! The rapids were so fun, my teens loved it and it tired them out! The cookout food after was great. Nice options. Beautiful spot. I would not hesitate to go again. Wonderful day with family unplugged and out in nature.
response_from_owner_text: Amazing family day, Lorri! Thank you for including this in your "Cousin Trip". We knew the kids would love the action! Hope to see you again in 2025.

review_text: 2nd time rafting with this team! Incredible people who love what they do and it shows. Best rafting company in the area hands down. Can't wait to get back here! 10/10 experience. Thank you to Frank and his whole family + staff for an incredible day.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks, Parker. Awesome day with you and the boys. Looking forward to your 3rd trip with us sometime soon!

review_text: Went mainly for the foam pit. Wasn't allowed in with my three year old. "She was too small."
Located in the center of South Deerfield, the staff are very knowledgeable. There is a lot to do here, but needs to presented better.

Brian and his team put together an amazing overnight on the Connecticut River for our group. The food, camp site, transportation, and communication throughout the whole process was ideal. Would highly recommend Adventure East to anyone looking to get outdoors!
My first time forest bathing....such a mindful, peaceful experience.  Ami is very knowledgeable in Native American medicine and I will never forget the serenity I felt in the forest.

Had a great hike of about 5 miles to Rattlesnake Knob in November 2023 to see the full moon. It was a perfect late afternoon for a hike. Two great view points at the top -- and the moon rising over the fall foliage was spectacular. Thanks to our guides Monica and Grant for a wonderful experience. The elevation gain was very gradual. Headlamps were provided if needed. If hiking at night sounds a little scary, the group setting is a good way to experience this full moon hike!!! Another amazing hike in February 2024 to Richardson Overlook on The New England Trail. Great views of the full moon, Mt. Monadnock, and Grace Mt. Also passed by Hidden Pond on the way up and under the moonlight on the way down. Great bonfire, two kinds of chile, peppers, chocolate chip cookies, all cooked up on the bonfire. Thanks to guides Brian and Jess for an amazing adventure!!!!
response_from_owner_text: Damon, great to have you on another full moon hike! Thanks for the review and great photos!

review_text: After years of hiking, I can confidently say this was the best hiking experience of my life! Brian is an amazing guide. He is not only knowledgeable about the forest and specifics of hiking but also is incredibly thoughtful about the experience itself. He took time out with the group to make sure everyone was comfortable and enjoying their experience. He paused to remind us to be in the present moment with nature, to be still and silent and grateful. The entire staff at the summit went above and beyond in their care for us. Thank you to the entire staff! I will be signing up for more adventures!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you, Lisa, for joining us and making a memorable experience. It was a special night and what we hope will be the first of many experiences with Mount Grace Land Conservation Trust.

review_text: The full moon hike at Mount Stratton was such a fun and invigorating winter adventure. The trail was satisfyingly challenging and rewarded us with a picture perfect overlook to enjoy the moonrise. I loved trekking back in the dark and  occasionally turning off our headlamps to look up at the stars. We look forward to getting outside with Adventure East again!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks Kelley. It was great to have you and Sam on our hike!

review_text: We had an amazing trip with Brian and the adventure east team. Brian put together an amazing two day kayaking and camp trip for us and cooked two incredible meals on our behalf. HUGE recommend for anyone thinking about a trip.
It was a beautiful night on the CT River. Adventure East is so great to work with, from start to finish. This is our 2nd kayak trip with them & we will be back!
I very much enjoyed the Forest bath with Ami Jean. She led the group on a beautiful hike and did a wonderful job sharing her knowledge and love of nature.

Much steeper than it looks. The car path and the two hiking trails were deceptively angled. With a name like Sugarloaf, I expected a pleasant, hilly area with easy trails to meander through. Instead your options to reach the observation area are as follows: a narrow blacktop carpath, a difficult steep inclined hiking trail, and a less steep but still completely uphill trail that runs alongside the carpath but lower than it. The observation area was nice enough, just a couple of parking lots, a covered firepit and pavilion, restrooms and an old tower with alright views. You'll mostly see the Connecticut River and the surrounding town, nothing that interesting to look at to be fair. The breeze was nice though. I'm not sure I'll be back again but it was decent enough to visit at least once. Another thing I noticed was the distinct lack of native flora at the observation point.. they opted for green lawns and non-native flower plantings instead? Strange choice when Massachusetts has a huge variety of beautiful native plants that host a wide array of pollinators that would certainly bring up the value of this dirt mound from a biodiversity supportive standpoint. Main wildlife observed were eastern grey squirrels, chipmunks, common insects, redwing blackbirds, american robins, if you're lucky a kestrel, eastern swallowtail butterflies (both canadian tiger and black), and other various song birds. The plant blue vetch was also a common sight here, along with clovers, narrow leaf plantain and feverfew.
Really cool view! $5 parking at the very top for Massachusetts residents. Not much to do at the top but they have picnic tables and grills.
North side trail is short, a little steep, but easy. Kids can do it too. Ample parking to drive up as well. Great views of the valley, small observation tower, picnic tables, bathrooms etc.

Tranquility. Serenity. Pleasant atmosphere. It smells the scent of the earth and embraces the sky. Stunning views. There are bathrooms for the public. A charming view for photography lovers. There is a tower that you can climb on to see the view from the top. There is also binoculars if you want to see distant places. It costs a quarter of a dollar. You put it in the piggy bank and the binoculars work after that.  Friendly people. I went with my friends. We brought our lunch with us and grilled meat. We sang some songs. The important thing is that the session was quiet and we had some fun. Parking is only $5 for residents of Massachusetts.

One of the best views of the Connecticut river valley in the area! There is a hiking trail that goes around the mountain. There is a tower on top of the mountain. You can get really great pictures from. Also a auto road that's open for travel on seasonal travel. The auto trail in parking area to the top of the summit has a fee. You can download the Yodel app to pay the fee.

Pretty easy hike to do with my 5 kids (ages 4-11). Bathrooms available up top. Picnic areas. Beautiful views. There are even a few geocaches along the way! Great place to check out if you love the outdoors!

Nice little loop of trails up here, nothing majorly strenuous nor a particularly long hike regardless of your direction of travel going up to the top, but pretty solid scenery!! It is a little steep regardless of which side you go up, but depending on your ability level, it's really not a bad trek at all, only a little over 2 miles, and the summit is about 900 ish feet... but the views for such a short mountain are pretty great!  plus on this particular trip there was some snow to lay in and roll around in, along with some great sticks to pick up and chew on along the way!!
This is my favorite hike to see the fall foliage of the pioneer valley.  I grew up in this area and went to umass so it is an annual tradition.  Well maintained trails and roads
Wrong name.  not a children's museum. And they get mad when you show up asking for the museum.
Great events with local artists demonstrating crafts
Beautiful.

I was nervous after reading some of the 1 star reviews but let me tell you this place was awesome! So magical! I LOVED the "stained glass" butterfly the most! The person I was with had a butterfly on them for at least 6 minutes with several staff seeing and doing nothing. I had 2 different ones land on me and no one rushed over. The staff are walking around continuously if that's what those reviewers meant but that's their job. We had a great time. We bought "painted lady" caterpillars and are watching them grow into butterflies. Coolest place for a great price! We drove almost 2 hours to avoid the pike but it was worth the drive! Also it's right up the street from Yankee Candle, so it definitely worth the trip! Will be returning with more people for sure!

I read the bad reviews because it's kind of a long drive and a little bit pricey, but I'm a big butterfly fan so I went. Anyway. I have to say that anyone that gives this place a negative review is not there for the butterflies. There's so many butterflies. It's amazing. Butterflies landed on me multiple times and no one said anything to me. I wore a very brightly colored dress which worked and I had so many butterflies land on me. We also saw a hummingbird. I went with my 14-year-old and my 10-year-old and my 4-year-old. Me and my 4-year-old could have stayed there all day long. My 14-year-old and 10-year-old quickly got bored. It's also fairly hot in there. From some of the reviews I was worried that my 4-year-old would get yelled at because he is a little meddlesome but he was his regular self and no one said anything to him. This is an amazing place and I would honestly just like to go there by myself and just sit there all day.

One of our favorite places to visit. Great for all ages to enjoy watching butterflies and learning about insects as well as reptiles, amphibians and some birds. There's also small fish ponds. The little birds running around are so cute (and they eat/cleanup dead butterflies)

No outside food or drink. Wear bright colors to attract butterflies, but be mindful not to touch them or step on them.

Good for a little over an hour. Cute gift shop too.
This place is AMAZING!! It exceeded my expectations so so much! I loved it there, it totally worth the visit! It's informative and wholesome. Take your time, seat around and just enjoy your time.

Magic wings is a great little spot to take young kids. There is a room full of reptiles, amphibians, lizards, and insects, which is a lot of fun to oggle at. The butterfly conversatory is through a door beyond that, so it makes the kids feel like it's hidden or secret, which is fun. As soon as you enter, you are hit by colors and wings and plants and warmth. It's a really magical place.

In addition to the butterflies, there are also toirtoises, quails, koi and a few more lizards. There's tons of plants and flowers to look at too and lots of benches to pause and take in the views.

The only drawback and the reason I didn't give magic wings 5 stars is because it is relatively small. We went nice and slow and looked at absolutely everything and still only stayed around an hour (which included our time at the gift shop where my 3 year old couldn't decide what he wanted).

Had such a lovely time here today. I love seeing butterflies back home in the UK, but there is something extra special about seeing exotic species in a warm greenhouse. The density of butterflies is very high here with lots of benches to sit on in the hope one will land on you. I enjoyed watching the females lay eggs on their preferred leaves. There are finches flying around and quails running across the floor between feeding stations. There are a good number of interesting tanks with various frogs, geckos and insects in a room before the butterfly house. I don't think I've seen such a good collection of extras including at my beloved Slimbridge. Toilets were good, staff were great and the shop was full of cool things. There were a great mix of families and young student age visitors here and we were even allowed to park our RV here overnight as most campgrounds are shut this time of the year.

Love taking the children here.  The variety of lizards, insects, and amphibians that are also on display make this a place for anyone to enjoy.  Never disappointed in the butterflies other than when we have to leave.

Very pleasant staff and helpful.
We had a great time looking at the frog  lizards and insects trying to find them .
Then we moved on to the butterfly habitat . You can walk all around and enjoy them zooming by or sit and take in there beautiful colors

Historic Deerfield has an outstanding collection of preserved, restored, and rebuilt eighteenth and nineteenth century homes. The houses are lined up on historic Old Main Street. The houses have guided tours which allow you to experience and learn the history of each house. The Flynt Center of Early New England Life is a modern museum in Historic Deerfield that displays over 2,500 artifacts from across New England. Some of the houses also offer demonstrations of life in this village in early America. All together there are over 12 different buildings in the village.
For all that Historic Deerfield offers there are some things which could be better. Some of the houses are currently not open due to renovations or simply not having enough staffing. Although tours are offered for different buildings they are offered at the top of the hour only. It would be better to allow for self guided tours, or audio tours in many of the historic houses. This way visitors could see many more of the houses and get to see everything that is there. The village does need to showcase more of the history that it has, and there were simply too many houses that were closed.
Tickets should be purchased in the Visitor Center. The gift shop is across from the Visitor Center and offers many different Historic Deerfield items. Some of the best houses to see in the village include the Wells-Thorn House, the Sheldon House, the Williams House, and the Barnard Tavern. An interesting place with lots of history.

Wonderful place..... absolutely strongly recommend! All the houses are spread alone a Main Street; the interpreters are all so engaging and passionate!! We spent about three hours and barely went through half of the houses. Will definitely need to come back.

Thank you, Historic Deerfield!!!

We were only able to visit for a few hours, but had an amazing time. There were fun learning opportunities and demonstrations throughout the day, such as cooking on an open hearth, and carpentry using tools from the 17th -19th centuries. Many historic buildings and guided tours within the scenic mile long district. The wonderful Deerfield Inn features a restaurant that serves savory dishes fireside in fall and winter, all day. (Reservations are a good idea). A large museum, post office, and a charming gift shop. Tickets were only $18 for adults, sold at the visitor's center. We loved every minute & hope to return soon to these friendly people in this beautiful historic town.

If you are in the area, recommend you take time to stop. We visited in the fall and the neighborhood's decorations made both aesthetically pleasing and calming. I was also pleasantly surprised at how much the museum had.

Deerfield is one of my favourite places to visit. I love all of the old historic buildings and the highschool is amazing. everything is so beautiful to just walk around and look at. but if you want more of an experience then i highly recommend doing the house tours. they are so fun and interesting to do. I think it is a bit slow paced as it took us around an hour just for one house, but i dont mind that at all. I'm sure if you ask for a quick tour they will give you one :) be sure to visit the gift shop and the museum! both are so wonderful and so much to see!

If you enjoy historic houses, you will love this place. Some houses have guided tours, and the guides are quite knowledgeable. Others are self-guided with a docent near the entrance. There is a nice gift shop opposite the Visitors Center. I only had a few hours to spend and therefore didn't get to see the entire street. I will go back.
If you are into old graveyards, do visit this one. It's at the end of a side street, ask for directions.
Spent half a day visiting historic homes. Some homes had a tour guide; others were self-guided.  Guides were very knowledgeable. Do need more time to visit - at least one whole day.
If you are into historic houses this is the place to visit in Massachusetts. Did a few tours of the homes and the guides were fantastic.

SRAC APPROVED! What a fun rapid, just wish it was longer! We rafted 6mi from the dam, 4 of us in the raft seen in the vid. With 2 people is looks smooth as silk, with 4, things got wild! We shuttled the gap a half dozen times and loved every second. Great for beginners! Too easy? Try a kayak! Still too easy? Grab gramps old canoe and SEND IT. Brah.
Most peaceful place in Massachusetts.
Zoar Gap at low levels. You can clearly see the hammer and the anvil at this level
A very underrated white water river. You can run it as a class 2, or challenge yourself and make it a class 3. Easy and hard features make a great place for crews with mixed experience levels.
My FAVORITE rapid on this stretch of the Deerfield. Fun times, fun times.
Great place for any type of boating that involves whitewater. Not a water person? Great scenery.
The gap isn't what it was... it's still a class III but now just two holes at 1000 cfm
Great rapids!

It's alright. The Japanese knotweed and grape leaf has taken over most of the area. There's sand enough to fish off of. There's a healthy amount of parking to access the area.

The parking area has no bathrooms or picnic tables or lighting. The walkway to the water is pretty washed out as of 7/14/2023. People are crossing the bridge in vehicles.
5.30am only the ducks are out.

Totally totally line this place very nice and quiet place to just spend the hot day.. Please leave everything clean . It wasn't dirty with yeah but just saying we have to maintain it this way so everyone can enjoy..I sure do easy access for parking off road. Going down to the river there is a little hard no stairs just woods
Beautiful scenery, great for fishing,  tubing , kids just wading around.
Great Deerfield River access, easy walk, beautiful views in all seasons.
Scenic Bridge, decent view

Beautiful area
Water was low
Tubes were getting stuck a lot
Always went swimming & rafting, & fishing here

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: I think is a lot to pay $8 per person not per car but it is a great family place it's really enjoyable. There are bathrooms, lifeguards and grills. Overall it's a beautiful and great place to visit with the fam.

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: The river was about 2" deep because they were preparing for rain later so it made it difficult to do anything in the water. I get that it's not usually like that but it made the rest of the day very difficult.

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: Really open and air centric. Non-crowded and safe. The playground was close too for the little ones to have play options. Cheap ice creams, free water fountain, good for laps in the River or just regular swimming. Want to go again!

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: Big place lots of space, bathrooms and changing area. Playground, basketball, volleyball, picnic tables and river beach. The lifeguards show up at 12:00.

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text:
It's a nice little kids park.. that's it.
If you want to BBQ and keep the little ones entertained this is the place. If you have grandparents that want to "go out" but not really do anything, this is the place. Teenagers will not be thrilled. Unless they just want to sunbathe. And if you want to go swimming-swimming this is not the place. Maybe the water has gotten high enough at some point in the past but it's not even knee high and it's About to be July. There aren't any bike trails in the park just the one leading to the park.

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: It's a beautiful place. My family and I go there to walk our dog all through the fall, winter and spring (for free). Recently I picked up my step kids and drove the hour from their mom's house to Greenfield. We needed groceries and Big Y is on our way home to Turners Falls, so not wanting to bring four young kids to the grocery store I brought them here as it's the closest playground I know of. It was already after five pm and they didn't bring swim suits. I dropped them off and was pulling out to go back to the grocery store and was stopped and told that even though the swimming was closed, we needed to pay. I had to pay $10 for them to use the playground when there are tons of free playgrounds in Greenfield and Turners. Put up a sign about the bacteria in the water and send people home. You should not be charging money if the swimming area isn't open. We were not impressed. Also, that late in the day and you're still charging..for just using the playground?

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: Beautiful. And the river is really green! Great place for the family.

place_name: Green River Swimming and Recreation Area
review_text: It's a nice place for a picnic and the good part is it has a kids playground also

Was not what I expected or hoped for based on other reviews. I don't recommend going on a Saturday in July if you're looking for a place to relax and swim. Hundreds of noisy people, smoking, music, large buses and just way over crowded. No exaggeration. I drove up river just around the corner, found a secluded place where we could swim and cool off and avoid the crowd. I'm sure if the picnic area had fewer visitors it would be nice, but I most likely will not return.

Town run and maintained picnicking area off the beaten path of the Mohawk Trail. The best part other then an occasional Train passing through on the other side of the road is there is potty toilets out in the middle of the wilderness. A good stopping point if you know where it is, if you're leaf peeping. It's on Zoar Road off of Route 2, at the bottom before you start to climb the mountain route. And the river is on the other side.  If you like water rafting or fishing and canoeing there is plenty of water in the river upstream. Get dropped off up stream have fun going down the river and Portage out at the stairs in the park. From what can be seen from the road there is small Rapids along the route. Water volume (cubic feet per second) is controlled by the power grids generating electrical dam upstream in Vermont. There is a small Cemetery in the middle of the park with a small stone wall built around it. Fishing in this area prohibits the use of live bait.

If you read all this and checked out my photos please tap the like button.
Nice and open picnic area with access to a fun rocky section of the Deerfield River. Be careful though, it can fill up quickly if they release the dam upstream!
Beautiful place to go with the family and friends. Going down the river tubing or kayaking is fun & relaxing
Beautiful well maintained picnic area.  Cool clear water

** attention ** please pick up after yourself!!

There is no more parking available here anymore there are " No Parking " signs everywhere at the bottom and at the top of the tubing locations there are signs tlthat read" live parking only, cars will be towed after 30 minutes " so if you plan on making your own tubing trip make sure you can have some one drop/pick you up. It's not the way it was 2 years ago. But they still drop the dam, so the water rises at the picnic area at 2:30 and the tubing is still worth it  would rate 5 star but the parking is now a big inconvenience. If you go please pick up after yourself. It only takes one group to ruin it for the rest of us.
This is a peaceful place to spend some time

This Used to be a lovely and tranquil place to go picnic, barbeque, swim and dogs were welcome on a leash.
Now it's Overcrowded, most people are from out of state, New York City for the most part and they litter, are vulgar and Rather Rude. Not All but a large enough percentage to have changed Everything and Not for the better.
When people visit Another Town or State they should attempt to Clean up After themselves, Follow the Rules and be polite.

This is a terrific craft fair with a nominal entry fee of $5 and a wonderful array of genuine handmade or crafted items including clothes, art, jewelry, woodwork, sculpture, honey, bath soaps and scents, wall art and much more. There are also food booths with fudge, balsamic oils, quesedillas, and full on food trucks.  Parking can be a little bit of a challenge though we found a spot early fairly easily.  They provide a printed program of the vendors with their location and a raffle for some nice prizes. The setting of Old Deerfield has a charm that can't be duplicated. Highly recommended!

It was great!  We saw it all and got some nice gifts you won't find at the mall.  Love going and have gone for 5 years.  Before moving to New Hampshire, we always went to the Greenville, SC Christmas craft fair.
Had a wonderful time despite the threat of rain which was minimal. Miss the kettle corn and apple crisp  vendors.

Show organizer is accusatory and rude to his artisans.  He accuses artists That they don't make the products and take offense when you correct him with evidence (photos) of your studio and the process of making the work.  He treds a fine line with this demeanor because he needs to realize that we (the artists) don't need him but he needs us to actually have a successful show.  With an attitude like his the show will surely decline rapiditly .  It's a shame, to see a long standing event be managed so poorly and to see an older gentleman (the promoter) speak to people in this manner.  I don't recommend this event to other artisans and antendees.

Tucked between Rts. 5 & 10 and Old Main Street Deerfield is a quiet New England street. The Memorial Hall Museum & Pocumtuck Valley Memorial Association open their lawn to crafters. You can find beautiful leather, woodworking, jewelry. There are tents of soaps, dip mixes & honey. Just strolling from tent to tent, sitting for a bit or looking for the perfect present. Just a beautiful walk in Deerfield.
Good variety of crafters, not too big. Good way to spend a sunny afternoon. Take advantage of the park and ride service - it's easy and fast.
Can not say much about this place...the whole area was closed. Probably only operational during the summer!
Mid sized craft fair, well organized, with good food and something for everybody. Worth a visit.
Gnar gnar

Don't waste your time or money to get your LTC permit here, The lead instructor was rude, unprofessional and was too busy talking about his own life stories rather than teaching his out dated course outline. And you DO NOT get your certificates at the end of the class, he mails them a week later.
Best club in W MA.  Friendly club environment. Facilities well maintained and not crowded.  Good value for money.
Excellent location, good place for safety course.
Super maintained range love it
Best facility, best members in western MA
Very nice ranges.
Fun times
Love the club
